post.body: That. Is. Awesome. Did you start that? I freaking love it.
you just don't want me at home, bugging you all day ;)
Haha just burst out laughing. Supposedly the MBTA is OK in snow, just bad with rain. But #MBTAsux is still true.
dude, why don't we get that option? It's the internet!
They've never been fans of that here, but I like the sound of it. May have to push for it under these snowy circumstances.
very cute, good find!
Nice work. Don't forget, nothing spreads the word like the internet!
Aw, that's so cute! And totally something I would say. I'll now be anxiously watching Twitter to see if she's right ;)
Well said. That's why I always preface my cooking with "this probably tastes horrible, but just try it." I can only go up!
great minds with good taste ;)
Agreed, 100% Place itself is OK, bar's decent but food is always "meh."
Vox Populi's menu sounds amazingly delicious, but is less than average. And tastes worse 'cuz it sounded so freakin good.
We're animals, it's ingrained in our brains. JK!
Wow, that's beyond bad. Was there a snowbank there before?
if it's a cell phone, the missed call will show up and I'll know you want to talk. No need for a VM that says "call me back."
RE: phone msg. That is awesome. Did it work? Checking out the post now.
that would be amazing! I delete the alert thing but bypassing calling would be useful. Potential for accidental deletion tho.
I've been accused of ignoring people or being a total spaz because of it. Is it a flaw, or is it us? ;)
Sounds like they want to seem like the "real" 1.If you make yours better it should rise naturally (think official bands on MySpace)
Does sound silly 'cuz it's not news, but maybe good news/status quo is good news right now. Can't hurt for SEO!
Depends how it's done. If it's good, ask to differentiate as fan page, not official. Bad, I'd say compete or petition to take down
I eat mine to not go back there ;)
Sales are good excuses to try new things ;)
I work "on the internet." Which is at my house as well as office. So theoretically, I should be able to work there in inclement weather.
We're rallying for a snow day tomorrow. Don't think the boss is budging. Yeah, remember the 6+ hr commute home this time last year?
Cartoon on how to irritate people who may (or may not) deserve it: http://www.zoitz.com/comics/coffee3.png
Facebook is broken; seems to be happening a lot recently. May need a new favorite procrastination destination (Twitter doesn't count, obvi).
Kicking myself for not reading Amazon user feedback before buying. If you need something in reasonable time, don't buy from Sife Athletics.
Had to let my "Facebook baby" go. So sad. @danzarrella and I spent months making something cool that I'm sure will be undone in a week.
Definitely going to snow. Or at least precipitate in some form. My internal meteorology (previously broken wrist) says so.
Most convoluted coincidences ever: $10k in a box of crackers. WTF? http://tinyurl.com/7ttldt Thanks to @josephmorin
RT @bitchinmona Boston TweetUp and do-goodness. Ideas and general interest solicited here: http://tr.im/tweetup4good
Flash site is annoying, but I like the idea of Healthy Choice's "Working Lunch" http://workinglunch.msn.com/#/homepage/2008-11-25V1176059/
With email, text messages, caller ID and missed call alerts, why do people still leave long, rambling voicemails?
My new title is "fabulous," per a coworker's email. New business cards are on the way.
Argh, I miss Gmail messages that continue a conversation ALL THE TIME. So frustrating.
Not happy about more heavy snow for NYE, but at least I can still wear a cute outfit since we're doing it up mi casa.
Sweet, I love impromptu "teach me Facebook right now" meetings. Fbook for Dummies crash course in 5.
My ladies are almost here! Along with a 5 day weekend...dangerous.
Walpole gets press not about the prison: http://tinyurl.com/8pg9as Not much better though.
